item.title: PostgreSQL Data Types: Date, Timestamp, and Time Zones
item.description:
Continuing our series of PostgreSQL Data Types today we’re going to introduce date, timestamp, and interval data types.

PostgreSQL implementation of the calendar is very good, and we’re going to show some mice example about how confusing this matter is. The time zone notion in particular is mainly a political tool these days, and it makes no sense on an engineering principle: there’s no way to solve time zone problems from first hand principles!

item.title: PostgreSQL and the calendar
item.description: The modern calendar is a trap for the young engineer’s mind. We deal with the calendar on a daily basis and until exposed to its insanity it’s rather common to think that calendar based computations are easy. That’s until you’ve tried to do it once. A very good read about how the current calendar came to be the way it is now is Erik’s Naggum The Long, Painful History of Time.
